items.sentence: Tom said he wasn\'t going to wait for permission.
Tom said he wasn\'t in the mood to do that today.
We arrived at the museum after a ten-minute walk.
We did a lot of singing and dancing at the party.
I\'d like to thank Tom for everything he\'s done.
Tom has a daughter that goes to school with Mary.
Tom has a hard time believing anything Mary says.
Tom has already been told that he has to do that.
I can\'t do this, so please don\'t ask me to try.
I can\'t find Tom. I think he must\'ve gone home.
I had no sooner sat down than the telephone rang.
Tom just shook his head and didn\'t say anything.
Tom knew he didn\'t have anything to worry about.
Tom hasn\'t come yet. He must\'ve missed the bus.
Tom hasn\'t yet done what we\'ve asked him to do.
I think Tom has been to Boston at least one time.
I think Tom needs to be told about what happened.
I think Tom should be able to do that by himself.
I think Tom was the one who cut down those trees.
I think Tom will want to talk to Mary about that.
